name: The Perspective Portal
description: A shimmering portal stands before you, showing reflections of different personas and perspectives. It seems to respond to specific viewpoint instructions.
promptTask:
Goal: Align the portal to a specific perspective.
Lesson: Using persona and perspective constraints in prompts.
Craft a command that specifies a particular persona, role, or perspective that should be adopted when viewing through the portal.
successMessage: As you instruct the portal to show you the chamber from the perspective of an experienced architect with a focus on historical preservation, the shimmering surface shifts to reveal hidden structural elements and ancient design patterns that were previously invisible, pointing the way forward.

feedback.noPersona: Perspective Error: Your command doesn't specify a persona or perspective. Try requesting to view things 'as a [specific role]' or 'from the perspective of [specific viewpoint]'.
feedback.vaguePersona: Persona Detail Error: Your persona specification is too vague. Try a more specific role, expertise, or perspective.
feedback.wrongAction: Action Error: '{action}' is not the appropriate way to interact with the portal. Try asking to view or see through it from a specific perspective.
feedback.noTarget: Target Error: What do you want to {action}? Specify that you're interacting with the portal or requesting a particular perspective.
feedback.wrongTarget: Target Error: There is no '{target}' here. The perspective portal is the focal point of this chamber.
feedback.tooGeneric: Specificity Required: Your command is too generic. The portal requires a specific persona or perspective to function properly.
